1400.name: Village Square of Immak
1400.description:
A cobblestoned village square is here with a sturdy old well in the middle,
benches line the edges of the cobblestoned square for travellers and
townsfolk alike to take a load off. To the north is the blacksmith and
tailor's shop, as well as the road out of town. To the south, a road leads
to the docks.

exdescs.bench:
Sturdy benches made of wood painted white are here lining the edges of the
cobblestone square.
exdescs.benches:
Sturdy benches made of wood painted white are here lining the edges of the
cobblestone square.

1401.name: Immak
1401.description:
The town of Immak stretches before you, to the north is a well travelled
road leading away from the town and into the forests. The air smells of
sea salt, and the sound of a hammer and anvil come from the east, where
the blacksmith has her shop set up. To the west is a clothier, and to the
south lay the village square.

1402.name: Immak Clothing Store
1402.description:
Inside this wooden building is an assortment of textiles, as well as a loom
and supplies to sew many an outfit. Some outfits hang on the walls, mostly
to demonstrate the abilities of the tailor here.

1403.name: Immak Blacksmith
1403.description:
This building is made of stone and is quite hot and loud, the forge
radiates an intense heat that seems not to bother the woman at it. The
clanging of her hammer echoes off the walls, only briefly stopping when
she takes a customer's order.

1404.name: Road North of Immak
1404.description:
A well travelled road leads north-south. To the north is a large forest,
and to the south is the dwarven port town of Immak. The ground is hard
packed dirt, flanked on either side by grasslands.

1405.name: Immak
1405.description:
A hardpacked road travels north-south here, the village square is to the
north and the docks, general store, and pub are to the south. The smell of
the sea is fairly strong here.

1406.name: Immak General Store
1406.description:
This wooden building holds a plentiful multitude of crates, barrels and
kegs. Travelling supplies are the specialty here, with smoked fish and
seashell knickknacks being the most plentiful.

1407.name: Immak
1407.description:
Many footprints have hardened the dirt here to a very smooth throughfare.
The noise of the docks to the south can be heard from here, only slightly
noisier than the pub to the west. To the east, carts of merchandise sit
outside of the general store, where travellers and residents alike can
stock up on supplies for journeys taken by sea or by land.

1408.name: Immak Docks
1408.description:
The docks are a noisy place, full of sailors pulling in ships, hauling
cargo onto and off of said ships, and the occasional beggar looking for a
handout. The sounds and smells of the ocean can still be heard and smelled
over it all, however.

1409.name: Shoreline of Wislyu
1409.description:
The sea meets the land here on the shoreline of Wislyu. Boats pass through
here on their way to and from Immak.

1410.name: Immak Docks
1410.description:
The docks are a noisy place, full of sailors pulling in ships, hauling
cargo onto and off of said ships, and the occasional beggar looking for a
handout. The sounds and smells of the ocean can still be heard and smelled
over it all, however.

1411.name: Shoreline of Wislyu
1411.description:
The sea meets the land here on the shoreline of Wislyu. Boats pass through
here on their way to and from Immak.

1412.name: Immak Docks
1412.description:
The docks are a noisy place, full of sailors pulling in ships, hauling
cargo onto and off of said ships, and the occasional beggar looking for a
handout. The sounds and smells of the ocean can still be heard and smelled
over it all, however.

1413.name: Shoreline of Wislyu
1413.description:
The sea meets the land here on the shoreline of Wislyu. Boats pass through
here on their way to and from Immak.

1414.name: In the Ocean
1414.description:
The oceans rock back and forth. To the north is the country of Wislyu on
the continent of Colista.

1415.name: In the Ocean
1415.description:
The oceans rock back and forth. To the north is the country of Wislyu on
the continent of Colista.

1416.name: In the Ocean
1416.description:
The oceans rock back and forth. To the north is the country of Wislyu on
the continent of Colista.

1417.name: On the Beach
1417.description:
This is a quiet strip of beach, away from the noise of the docks and pub.
To the northwest is a passage through the fields, and waves from the sea
crash against the beach to the south.

1418.name: Shoreline of Wislyu
1418.description:
The sea meets the land here on the shoreline of Wislyu. Boats pass through
here on their way to and from Immak. To the west, you can reach the Cove
of the Naiad Queen.

1419.name: In the Ocean
1419.description:
The oceans rock back and forth. To the north is the country of Wislyu on
the continent of Colista.

1420.name: A Narrow Footpath
1420.description:
A narrow footpath here travels through the plains. To the south, the
footpath meets the sands of the beach. To the north, the footpath
continues.

1421.name: A Narrow Footpath
1421.description:
A narrow footpath travels north and south here, the grass is pressed down
by the footsteps of the occasional traveller who wishes to skirt the edge
of Immak for one reason or another.

1422.name: Immak Pub
1422.description:
Boisterous drinkers enjoy themselves in Immak's pub at all hours of the day
and night. Gambling and drinking can be found here, as much as one could
ever want. A staircase leads up to some rooms that are occasionally rented
by passersby on their way to the north or who may be awaiting a sea
voyage. Harald is also a retired adventurer, willing to show newbies some
of his old tricks.

1423.name: A Narrow Footpath
1423.description:
A narrow footpath travels northeast and south here, the grass is pressed
down by the footsteps of the occasional traveller who wishes to skirt the
edge of Immak for one reason or another.

1424.name: Behind the Clothing Store
1424.description:
A narrow footpath travels southeast and east here, the grass is pressed
down by the footsteps of the occasional traveller who wishes to skirt the
edge of Immak. The backdoor of the Tailor's shop is here to the east.

1425.name: Cove of the Naiad Queen
1425.description:
The cove of the Naiad queen echoes the sounds of waves crashing against the
entrance. While no one lives here, you see many coins. Some are tarnished
from age, others from the sea and elements.

1426.name: Mouth of the Merroc River
1426.description:
The relative calm of the ocean is met by the surge of the river flowing
right into it. To the south lay endless expanse of ocean, and to the
north, the river leads inland.

1427.name: The Merroc River
1427.description:
The river moves rapidly from north to south, hastily making its way to the
sea.

exdescs.desc_freezing:
The Merroc River has completely frozen over due to the intense cold
weather. The surface is solid enough to walk across at the moment.

1428.name: The Merroc River
1428.description:
The river moves rapidly from north to south, hastily making its way to the
sea.

exdescs.desc_freezing:
The Merroc River has completely frozen over due to the intense cold
weather. The surface is solid enough to walk across at the moment.

1429.name: The Merroc River
1429.description:
The river moves rapidly from north to south, hastily making its way to the
sea.

exdescs.desc_freezing:
The Merroc River has completely frozen over due to the intense cold
weather. The surface is solid enough to walk across at the moment.

1431.name: Bridge over Merroc River
1431.description:
This sturdy stone bridge crosses the speedy Merroc River. It flows from
north to south, hastily making its way to the sea. Most of the time,
energetic travelers can be seen crossing the bridge at all times of day
and night. The Silzar's Road is safer than ever.

exdescs.desc_freezing:
The bridge is partially unnecessary at the moment as the Merroc River has
completely frozen over. Parts of the shining ice peek out through clumps
of snow.

1432.name: The Merroc River
1432.description:
The river moves rapidly from north to south, hastily making its way to the
sea.

exdescs.desc_freezing:
The Merroc River has completely frozen over due to the intense cold
weather. The surface is solid enough to walk across at the moment.

1433.name: The Merroc River
1433.description:
The river moves rapidly from north to south, hastily making its way to the
sea.
The river moves rapidly from northeast to southwest, hastily making its way to
the sea.

exdescs.desc_freezing:
The Merroc River has completely frozen over due to the intense cold
weather. The surface is solid enough to walk across at the moment.

1434.name: In the Ocean
1434.description:
The oceans rock back and forth. To the north is the country of Wislyu on
the continent of Colista.

1435.name: Road South of the Immak Woods
1435.description:
A well travelled road leads north-south. To the north is a
large forest, and to the south is the dwarven port town of
Immak. The ground is hard packed dirt, flanked on either side
by grasslands.

1436.name: Eastern Immak Road
1436.description:
This road runs through Immak and connects the Village Square off to the
west with the Merroc River Bridge to the east. It looks very well
travelled by a variety of individuals. To the north and south are small
homes, probably belonging to tradesman that make their home here in Immak.

1437.name: Road East of Immak
1437.description:
A hardpacked path here runs east-west. To the west is the Merroc River
Bridge leading into Immak. To the east, the road continues onward to the
neighboring nation.

1438.name: Immak Pub's Lounge
1438.description:
This is a fairly well-appointed lounge with two couches, three chairs,
and a nice floor rug. The corner of the room has a oaken table with four
stools around it, primarily for playing games, judging from the chess
board and two decks of cards. A fireplace crackles in the corner.

1439.name: Road
1439.description: This is a road leading west.

1440.name: East-West Road
1440.description:
A hardpacked path here runs east-west. To the west appears to be the
dwarven village of Immak. Continuing east leads to some sort of thick
woods.

1441.name: Ymir's Shoppe of Odds and Ends
1441.description:
This shop is cluttered and messy. You can barely see the owner amidst the
many piles of mismatched paraphenelia littered about!

1442.name: Road
1442.description:
This is a road leading west. It appears to connect to some sort of
footpath.
